org.cojen.tupl.repl

Interface MessageReplicator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, DirectReplicator, Replicator

    public interface MessageReplicator
extends DirectReplicator
    Message-oriented replication interface, which is a bit easier to use than StreamReplicator. Although it has slightly higher overhead, control message passing is handled automatically. Replicas are still required to be reading in order for control messages to be processed, however.
    See Also:
    StreamReplicator

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  MessageReplicator.Reader
      Interface called by any group member for reading committed messages.
      static interface  MessageReplicator.Writer
      Interface called by the group leader for proposing messages.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.cojen.tupl.repl.DirectReplicator

        DirectReplicator.Accessor

    • Method Detail

      • open

        static MessageReplicator open(ReplicatorConfig config)

        IllegalArgumentException - if misconfigured
        IOException

      • newReader

        MessageReplicator.Reader newReader(long index,
                                   boolean follow)
        Returns a new reader which accesses data starting from the given index. The reader returns EOF whenever the end of a term is reached. At the end of a term, try to obtain a new writer to determine if the local member has become the leader.

        When passing true for the follow parameter, a reader is always provided at the requested index. When passing false for the follow parameter, null is returned if the current member is the leader for the given index.

        Note: Reader instances are not expected to be thread-safe.

        Specified by:
        newReader in interface DirectReplicator
        Parameters:
        index - index to start reading from, known to have been committed
        follow - pass true to obtain an active reader, even if local member is the leader
        Returns:
        reader or possibly null when follow is false
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if index is lower than the start index

      • newWriter

        MessageReplicator.Writer newWriter()
        Returns a new writer for the leader to write into, or else returns null if the local member isn't the leader. The writer stops accepting messages when the term has ended, and possibly another leader has been elected.

        Note: Writer instances are not expected to be thread-safe.

        Specified by:
        newWriter in interface DirectReplicator
        Returns:
        writer or null if not the leader
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an existing writer for the current term already exists

      • newWriter

        MessageReplicator.Writer newWriter(long index)
        Returns a new writer for the leader to write into, or else returns null if the local member isn't the leader. The writer stops accepting messages when the term has ended, and possibly another leader has been elected.

        Note: Writer instances are not expected to be thread-safe.

        Specified by:
        newWriter in interface DirectReplicator
        Parameters:
        index - expected index to start writing from as leader; method returns null if index doesn't match
        Returns:
        writer or null if not the leader
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an existing writer for the current term already exists
